I'd argue against that. Just because you can make a concept, doesn't make it a good one. Battlecast resembles nothing to the other battlecasts, in terms of the rawness of their designs, how tank-ish they feel, not to mention you run into the same problem that Lunar Event Caitlyn ran into, as it just didn't resonate well.

Dark Star so far works best on monstrous entities, with I think it's biggest weakpoint being Varus, albeit a good skin regardless. Varus still resonates with a corruption theme, as he himself is in the process of being corrupted. Orianna works well as well, because she can be seen as a monstrosity base-wise, something no longer human, but a machine. They still resonate with the theme, Ahri does not. Even if she feels like a monster in the inside, her correlating visuals on the outside give no indication of that, unlike Varus. 

Deep Sea Ahri, even aside that it just doesn't look like a good skin, makes no sense at all. Why are we giving a Champion a water themed skin, when she is the furthermost away from water. Fire makes sense, one because it was a joke on Firefox browser, but the fact that her visuals are very firelike in general, there's a good visual connection.

 Syndra, although I'm not a fan of it, does a Water theme well because her visuals are much more fluid than wispy. Her Ult showing streaks of water flying towards you is a good connection between theme and visual, but I doubt you can do the same with Fire, to the same degree of well-doneness. I think it's one of the main downsides of getting a Pool Party Ahri, that it's hard to make wispy looking visuals look good as water. The SFX would honestly be doing most the work, splish splash sploosh. 

Fitting a theme doesn't mean it's a viable skin. The ~~too many~~ concepts of SG Urgot flying around does not automatically make it a viable skin theme that matches well.

I think you missed the point.

Just because Ahri **_'fits'_** the SG theme, doesn't mean she should get dropped into it. Lucian fits the theme too, to go with Ezreal and the theme's baseline of using tools/implements for their powers. But that doesn't mean it's the best design space room. He already looks like a modern (I mean setting, not like, skin quality) hero with sleek visuals, and a Star Guardian skin for him would compete against his base and Heartseeker options.

Much like how SG Ahri competes against Popstar Ahri for the Modern-Sleek design space.

Just because it fits, doesn't mean it's the best option.

The point I'm trying to make is that it isn't *just* fitting a theme. It's about how well it resonates with the character, how fitting it matches visuals, and does it make sense thematically. 

A little more indepth, SG Ahri's group are the Veterans of the SG group. They're older and more experienced. That's represented through SG's Ahri's confidence and arrogance, as well as the others chosen. Miss Fortune, Syndra, and Ezreal make decent choices because they all look and feel older, like a group that has been around a while where having a boy in the group is a smart choice. Don't ask me about Soraka, dialogue towards her is conflicting. 

https://am-a.akamaihd.net/image?f=https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/images/articles/2017/february/hsavn/Heartseeker_Lucian_Splash_v1.jpg

http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/fce71a47d1b18feeb600cb032d347ad6.jpg

Lucian does not fit the theme at all. For one, he is a *extremely* serious character. Unless you make it a legendary, his normal VO doesn't make a lot of sense, nor matches the more light heartedness of the SG line. Even his Heartseeker theme is much more serious, than the other Heartseekers, our main comparison being Varus. Varus's is "Haha, I'm lovey dovey, in a Cupid outfit". Lucian's is drop dead serious sexy, it's just not as comedic or cutesy as the other skins are. There is a huge difference in the pictures above. 

Even then, his general silhouette doesn't match a lot of light hearted anime themes, like the Magical School girl tropes. "Sleek" abilities isn't a main point either, cause look at Jinx, whose natural abilities are very rough and explosive. Last thing to mention is that it just isn't his playerbase. 

I may be assuming, but it's all based on personal like and preferences, people who like Lucian are more likely to watch Tri-gun or Hellsing Ultimate, than something cutesy like Madoka. To have your character who reminds you of Blade or something much more serious put into a cutesy media format, it's downright insulting to the playerbase of that champion. No one thinks "Yeah, lucian totally could be a Magical ~~boy~~ Girl. 

 It makes no sense on a base thematic level, for something badass and dead serious to go into something much light hearted. This is where I think Miss Fortune falls into this, I personally think she's the odd one out in all of this, and might've been better represented by someone like Sivir. 

That said, they wanted Older looking people for SG 2, so MF kinda fits that bill of mature. 

I'll stop there for now, but I am more than willing to continue explaining things for this. There is a lot of variables that include stuff, theme, lore, background and base visuals, that need considering, and Ahri matches that extremely well. I dare you to try and suggest some other Champions that would be a better fit following the conditions I'll set below. 

* They need to be more mature feeling, Lux is still a newbie, they need to feel like they're more experienced than her

* They need to be in their base skin, much more lighthearted than other champions. Not so serious. 

* It needs to make sense that they are a good guy

* It needs to resonate with the champion's main audiance

I will argue this all night if need be.

1.)
**Fiora**: More mature than Lux. She'd have to be to earn the title of 'Grand Duelist' for her base skin/lore.
**Sona**: Not to particularly draw attention to... certain aspects of her design, but yes, more mature.
**Leona**: Oh so very much.
**Taric**: Again, yes. He oozes maturity and experience.
**Vi**: Maybe not so much on the maturity side, or even seriousness, but I'd argue for more experienced at least.

2.)
**Fiora**: You got me there. Fiora is serious, but probably not in the top 10% of most serious champions out of the whole catalog. There is a toying to some of her lines.
**Sona**: Uhh, yep. Suuuuper too many musical puns to not call her lighthearted. Beyond that, she finds a joy in the tempo of combat, not in the spilling of blood or righting a wrong.
**Leona**: I'm gotten again. My best gal Leona is quite the serious lady. Then again, so is Syndra. Her ambition is a fury bordering onto wrath. She's the walking (or is it _floating_) definition of hell hath no fury like a woman-.
**Taric**: Taric, even now, has a sense of levity to his dialogue and lines.
**Vi**: Vi? Stands for _vitality_.  She's got a smile on her face, a laugh in her throat, and a spring in her step. She does what she does half because it needs to be done, and half because she'll have fun doing it.

3.) I actually question this one outright, because again.... Syndra, and before/after her is Jinx. It's NOT obvious that they're good, in fact it's super unobvious. Syndra works as a veteran fallen hero, but Jinx is as uncaring hero at her best points. They stretched the form for Jinx well beyond what they would have to for any of the five I selected.

4.) I question this as well, because it's different strokes for different folks. You assume a champion's visual design and how it is reached is the only thing that reflects back on the people who love/main said champion. I love Steven Universe, I adore Friendship Is Magic, and I'm currently on my sixth or seventh watch-through of Ouran High School Host Club.

I'm an engaging Tank main. Gimme a Sion, a Galio, a Rammus. Put me on Singed or Maokai or Thresh. If you want a sure win, let me walk onto the field as Leona. I want to be the first one in the fray, denying every little thing my enemies want to do like I'm smacking down a basketball saying "No-no-no~".

---------------------------------------------------------

You (as in anyone, not you specifically) can rationalize any champion fitting into almost any number of skin themes. The biggest factor though, when it comes to who gets what (or any) skins is -timing-. Since release, Ahri's averaged better than one skin a year. Partially, that's because she was made back when champions got 2 skins when launched. Even if you don't count Dynasty and Midnight though, that statement still stands. She came out in ultra late '11. We're halfway through '17 and she's on the cusp of her sixth post release skin. Eight months between Challenger and Academy, just under a year between Academy and Arcade, and it's looking like just under a year again for Academy to Star Guardian.

There -were- and still are other champions that could fit the role or theme, like Sivir which you mentioned and I totally agree with. Skins are decided well ahead of time and balanced on what themes could be explored, but more so than that, who doesn't already have a skin in the works or just released one.

Was it really the best use of resources and time to make another Ahri skin for a group theme, and make it a Legendary at that?

Obviously yes. Ahri skins sell better than hotcakes, and I've been led to believe hotcakes sell particularly well. But this is the internet, the nexus point of where people go to complain. Allow us to have this, then. Let us argue for the 'what could of been', because it might influence the 'what will be' of the future.

When you look over the grand scheme of things, they didn't -need- to pick Ahri specifically for this skin slot, and that's what we're complaining about. Someone else could of used the space better. So now we've got a Legendary Ahri skin that doesn't do much for the base character's design space for the price slot, and we're not gonna get another Ahri skin for a long while, closing off better utilizations of unexplored options (Bestial/Ravenous Ahri, Demonic Ahri, Program Ahri, Kigurumi Ahri etc).

-----------------------------------------
